relations.head: Mettl3
relations.label: methylate
relations.text: Intriguingly, this phenotype and inflammation were alleviated by the ablation of the m6 A methyltransferase Mettl3 in CD4+ T cells.

relations.head: Alkbh5
relations.label: remove
relations.text: In the psoriasis mouse model, depletion of the RNA demethylase, Alkbh5, from CD4+ T cells promoted the psoriasis-like phenotype and inflammation.

relations.head: N6-methyladenosine
relations.label: is on
relations.text: Mechanistically, we found that the m6 A modification of IL17A mRNA increased the expression of IL-17A (an important pro-inflammatory factor in psoriasis) and promoted psoriasis.

relations.head: IL17A
relations.label: promote
relations.text: Mechanistically, we found that the m6 A modification of IL17A mRNA increased the expression of IL-17A (an important pro-inflammatory factor in psoriasis) and promoted psoriasis.

analysis:
Context:  
• Psoriasis (disease)

Nodes:  
1) IL17A → Gene/RNA  
2) Alkbh5 → Gene/RNA  
3) Mettl3 → Gene/RNA  
4) N6-methyladenosine → Epitranscriptomic modification  
5) CD4+ T cells → Tissue/Cell Type  
6) Psoriasis → Disease  

Regulatory Relationships (direct):  
1) Mettl3 methylates N6-methyladenosine (meta-effect: increases IL17A)  
2) Alkbh5 removes N6-methyladenosine (meta-effect: decreases IL17A)  
3) N6-methyladenosine is on IL17A  
4) IL17A promotes Psoriasis
